./RSLLock.name: RSL Lock Example
./RSLLock.description: Encoding of Figure 7 Lock example from RSL paper

./RelAcqDblMP.name: Release-Acquire Double Message-Passing
./RelAcqDblMP.description: Encoding of Figure 8 message passing example from RSL paper

./FencesDblMP.name: Fence-Based Double Message-Passing
./FencesDblMP.description: Encoding of Figure 2 double message passing example from FSL paper

./FencesDblMPSplit.name: Fence-Based Double Message-Passing, Single Atomic Location
./FencesDblMPSplit.description: Adaptation of program from Figure 2 of FSL paper (with CAS accesses), using a single atomic location and correspondingly more-complex invariant which must be split between threads

./FencesDblMPAcqRewriting.name: Fence-Based Double Message-Passing, Single Atomic Location, Invariant Splitting
./FencesDblMPAcqRewriting.description: Adaptation of program from Figure 2 example from FSL paper, using a single atomic location with invariant stated such that automatic handling of conjuncts doesn't suffice; exercises invariant rewriting support

./RelAcqDblMPSplit.name: Release-Acquire Double Message-Passing, Single Atomic Location
./RelAcqDblMPSplit.description: Adaptation of program from Figure 2 of FSL paper, using Release/Acquire accesses, a single atomic location and correspondingly more-complex invariant which must be split between threads

./ARCRelAcq.name: Rust Reference Counter (Acquire/Release variant)
./ARCRelAcq.description: An adaptation of the Rust reference counting example from FSL++ paper. Several strengthened access modes allow for a proof using release/acquire

./ARCStronger.name: Rust Reference Counter (Fences variant)
./ARCStronger.description: An adaptation of the Rust reference counting example from FSL++ paper. Two strengthened access modes allow for a proof using atomics and fences

./ARCRelaxed.name: Rust Reference Counting (original)
./ARCRelaxed.description: Encoding of original example from FSL++ paper, using same specs as previous example. As expected, the example fails to verify (needs a more-sophisticated specification)

./FollyRWSpinlock.name: Facebook Folly Reader-Writer spinlock code
./FollyRWSpinlock.description: Encoding of the core reader-lock and writer-lock functions from Facebook's open-source Folly library. Two functions fail to verify, leading to three error messages (as expected with the given specifications, which cannot capture the cumulative effects of multiple atomic updates)

./FollyRWSpinlockStronger.name: Facebook Folly Reader-Writer spinlock code, two modified functions
./FollyRWSpinlockStronger.description: Encoding of the core reader-lock and writer-lock functions from Facebook's open-source Folly library. Two functions have been re-implemented with slightly less-efficient code whose correctness can, however, be captured by RSL-style atomic invariants.

TACAS'18.description: This webpage contains the full examples referenced in the paper "Automating Deductive Verification for Weak Memory Programs" submitted to TACAS 2018.
